wines.name: Mocenni Particella 91 2020
wines.description:
Covering 1,000 hectares within the enchanting province of Siena, nestled in the historic and captivating city of Tuscany, Bindi Sergardi's vineyards have been crafting exceptional wines for centuries. With a legacy dating back to 1349 and spanning 23 generations, this family-operated winery is dedicated to encapsulating its rich heritage in each and every sip of its wines.

Celebrated as ‘a great super Tuscan’, Bindi Sergardi’s Mocenni Particella 91 is a hugely popular red wine among the Vivino community. One member comments, “I had doubts if the high Vivino rating can be justified. Certainly, it can.” Join hundreds of Vivino customers and try Bindi Sergardi Mocenni Particella 91 today.

With a taste as unique as its hue, this brick red sauvignon boasts a bouquet of black currant, blackberry, blueberries, oak, tobacco and chocolate. Full bodied, with medium maturing tannins and balanced acidity, you’ll find the Bindi Sergardi Mocenni Particella 91 has a long, pleasant aftertaste.

Perfectly pairs with beef, lamb, veal, poultry and cured meats, making it essential to have waiting in the wings for any dinner party. Bindi Sergardi Mocenni Particella 91 2016 vintage rates better than any other year for this wine, so it's a great starting point to sample this variety.

wines.name: Mucho Más Tinto N.V.
wines.description:
One of the world's most renowned Spanish wines, N.V. Félix Solís Mucho Más Tinto is a fruity, yet deep full bodied red from Félix Solís, a family-run company that has its roots in heritage and history, while still managing to maintain its reputation of excellence. 

Sitting somewhere between dry and sweet, you can expect deep flavors of vanilla, oak and tobacco, enriched with sweet notes of red cherry and plum. Because of its slightly lighter flavor profile, this wine is perfect to be enjoyed at lunch or dinner, though our wine experts believe its best paired with beef, pasta, veal and poultry. It’s the perfect bottle to pick up and enjoy over lunch with friends, dinner with a loved one, or sipped together on the sofa on your next romantic date night. 

If you want to join the thousands of other Vivino users who have rated N.V. Félix Solís Mucho Más Tinto, pick up a bottle today, or lose yourself in our reviews, flavor profiles and winery profile before you decide to take the plunge.

Taste: The entrance is opulent, it persists to a full mouth feeling with well polished tannins. The end is fresh with a good persistence of complex aromas from ageing. It is a well balanced wine with good structure.

wines.description: It is generally sumptuous in colour, with a particularly subtle and pleasantly fruity aromatic strength, very ripe and concentrated flavours. It is harmoniously balanced, expressive and generous, with finesse and elegance. It has a great length on the palate, with a lively appeal and remarkable cellaring potential thanks to very fine, yet clearly present, tannins.

wines.name: Médoc 2021
wines.grapes: Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot
wines.description: One of the showpieces of the Medoc, this structured and firm wine has strong Cabernet flavors that give both dry tannins and juicy black currant fruits. Still youthful, this balanced wine is likely to age well.

wines.name: Haut-Médoc 2021
wines.description: Opaque black/purple colour, with notes of crushed rock, white flowers, graphite, blueberry and cassis, the wine is tight and needs to be coaxed from the glass. It is medium to full-bodied, with an excruciatingly tough-textured finish.

wines.name: Les Fiefs de Lagrange Saint-Julien 2021
wines.description: Lively, intense color, without premature evolution. The nose has a fine, elegant character with aromas of ripe fruit and slightly woody notes. In the mouth, the balance is long and consistent. The aftertaste brings out the purity of the fruit thanks to moderate tannins.

wines.name: G d’Estournel (Goulée by Cos d’Estournel) 2021
wines.description:
* A partir du millésime 2019, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel est renommé G d’Estournel.
* From the 2019 vintage, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel is renamed G d’Estournel.

The bounty and grace of nature. Goulée by Cos d’Estournel brings to mind a light sea breeze, refreshing eucalyptus and the tantalizing scents of juicy, ripe berries and rich cacao beans… Evoking an invigorating afternoon spent on the water with friends or a delicious meal in an oceanfront bistro softly lit by the glowing rays of the sun, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel is decidedly untamed, a bold and expressive wine.

wines.region: France / Vin de Pays / Pays d'Oc
wines.description: This Mourvèdre has a lovely intense red colour with purple tints. The first impression is very fruity with scents of strawberries, peaches and currants. This is followed by spicy scents of the "garrigue": marzipan, honey, lavender, thyme and bay leaves. This wine is astonishingly long and fat. It already has good, well-balanced tannins. The almost sweet finish leaves a smooth, velvety impression. Lots of character.

wines.region: France / Vallée du Rhône / Sud de la vallée du Rhône / Costières-de-Nîmes

Those creamy notes continue to your palate where they are joined with a light woodiness from the oak. This wine will melt in your mouth for a long, creamy finish.

Toasted & tobacco aromas hints at the end reflect its ageing in barrels. A sttrong introduction in mouth with all the smoothness of juicy fruits is combined with structuring and mature tannins. A dominant acidity develops a remarkably long persistency.

wines.description:
Smooth and deep ruby in color, Pago de Carraovejas Tinto is a robust red wine from the wine region of Ribera del Duero, Spain, which is located at the southern tip of the province of Burgos. It’s renowned for its cherry, blackberry and vanilla notes, alongside low acidity and low tannins. Perfect for wine connoisseurs and novices alike, it’s the perfect bottle to share alongside friends over a delicious dinner. 

As for pairings, this wine is an excellent choice to enjoy alongside meaty dishes that involve beef, lamb and game, so it’s perfect for sipping alongside a succulent steak dinner on date night. Made from the Tempranillo grape, this wine is rated highly across all of its vintages, however its 2018 vintage featured in the Top 25 Spanish Ribera del Duero red wines in the United States right now, so that might be a bottle you want to get your hands on. Additionally, its 2016 vintage rates better than any other year, so it’s fair to say this wine is an all round good choice, regardless of the vintage you choose. 

Read on for more reviews and pricing on Pago de Carraovejas Tinto at Vivino.

Campo Masua Amarone is the result of a selection process from a particularly suitable vineyard with ideal exposure and positioning, which make it one of the most interesting wines in our range. It is only produced in exceptional vintages; obtained from an accurate scrupulous selection of grapes from the vineyards, a 5 month raising process and ageing for 2 years in barrels and another year in the bottle. It is the synthesis of style and creativity while respecting traditions at the same time. A wine with an intriguing color, the nose expresses an intense, ethereal bouquet. The avour has charismatic personality with velvety tannins and a long echo of enveloping softness. Recommended with game, grilled meat, braised meat and mature cheeses.
Also enjoyable outside mealtimes in moments of meditation. Serve at 18°C, in wide-rimmed glasses, to enjoy its melodious nature.

wines.name: Amaranta Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2022
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Abruzzo (Abruzzes) / Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
wines.description:
Celebrated as ‘a deep and powerful wine that a novice can appreciate as much as a connoisseur’, the Amaranta Montepulciano d'Abruzzo is one of our best-selling reds for good reason.

Tenuta Ulisse’s Amaranta Montepulciano D’Abruzzo is a distinguished wine originating from the Montepulciano grape, giving it its distinctive ruby red with garnet reflections hue. Fermented for nine to 12 months in fine French and American barriques, the experienced winemakers have harnessed the full potential of the extraordinary terroirs and microclimates found within the Abruzzo region, to produce a drop unlike any other. 

The Vivino community rates Tenuta Ulisse Amaranta Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2022 vintage as better than any other year for this wine, so if you’re new to this wine, 2022’s vintage is a good place to start. On the other hand, Tenuta Ulisse Amaranta Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2016 vintage ranks number one in the Top 25 Italian Montepulciano d'Abruzzo wines in the United States right now, making it a guaranteed crowd pleaser.

Whether planning for a large dinner party, an intimate gathering or a date night for two, this wine pairs exquisitely with beef, pork, veal and pasta.

wines.name: Brunello di Montalcino 2020
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Toscane / Brunello di Montalcino
wines.description: Deep and bright with light shades of garnet red. Its bouquet is penetrating, very full and varied, reminiscent of wild berries. On the palate it is dry, warm, full-bodied, harmonious, delicate and austere at the same time, persistent.

wines.name: Castello della Sala Pinot Nero 2022
wines.description: Marchesi Antinori’s passion for viticulture is expressed through perseverance: their continuous pursuit for quality improvement, even in the smallest details. Research and development is an ongoing process both in the vineyards and in the cellars: selecting new clones of local and international varieties: experimenting with new techniques in the vineyards and vineyard altitudes, new approaches to fermentation and temperature control, experimenting with both traditional and innovative winemaking philosophies, using new types of oak for barrels, barrel size and age, and varying length of aging in the bottle before commercial release. To succeed at best expressing what a vineyard, grape, and a winemaker can achieve requires constant trial and error, both in the vineyard and in the winery. At Marchesi Antinori, these experiments include a wide range of different grape varieties and clones, planted in a variety of vineyards, different styles and sizes of fermentors as well as techniques of fermentation; barrel types and sizes; length of barrel and bottle aging.

wines.region: Italie / Northern Italy / Piémont / Barbera d'Alba
wines.description: Intense ruby - purple hues tending to garnet with ageing. Herbaceous and fruity aromas with hints of mature black fruit. Long and persistent finish with balanced acidity.

wines.name: Kreda 2021
wines.description: Deep ruby colour, intense scents of ripe fruit, prunes, voilet, with a rare elegance fully body, very important structure, with layers of velvety tannins and a wide spectrum of tertiary aroma.

wines.name: Maremma Toscana 2020
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Toscane / Maremma Toscana
wines.description:
Intense ruby red color and
with garnet . A wine that combines
strength , intensity , elegance , with soft tannins that
make round in the mouth . The nose is
fruity and with a nice spiciness . In the mouth the taste is
deep , but lively and well balanced .

wines.name: Il Rabdomante Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2022
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Abruzzo (Abruzzes) / Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

wines.name: Aglianico Castel del Monte 2021
wines.region: Italie / Southern Italy / Pouilles / Castel del Monte
wines.description:
Colour: Dark ruby red 
Aroma: continuous and complex in its succession of sensations – spice, mint, toasted oak, quinine and ink, jam, dried plums, and cherries under spirits.
Flavour: a wine of imposing structure, great balance, suppleness, elegance, and length.

wines.name: Aglianico Castel del Monte 2021
wines.region: Italie / Southern Italy / Pouilles / Castel del Monte
wines.description:
Colour: Dark ruby red 
Aroma: continuous and complex in its succession of sensations – spice, mint, toasted oak, quinine and ink, jam, dried plums, and cherries under spirits.
Flavour: a wine of imposing structure, great balance, suppleness, elegance, and length.

wines.name: Contrada Chiappemacine 2020
wines.description: Ruby red color wine.Aroma intense range of fruity and spicy with notes of wild berries and white pepper.Savory, expansive and persistent.

wines.name: Il Rabdomante Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2022
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Abruzzo (Abruzzes) / Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

wines.name: Valpolicella Superiore 2019
wines.description: It is a deep ruby color with a spicy, peppery tobacco-scented nose with mineral touches. It also offers jammy red fruits, sherry and hints of coffee. The wine is elegant and has a distinguished aromatic complexity. A rich, fresh, fat, full-bodied wine with sweet tannin and a long finish.

wines.name: Il Borgo Toscana 2022
wines.description: Bright ruby red in its color. The aromas are aristocratic and velvety with hints of underwood, leather and raspberry.

wines.name: Casa Lupo Amarone della Valpolicella 2020
wines.region: Italie / Northern Italy / Vénétie / Valpolicella / Amarone della Valpolicella

wines.name: Dut' Un 2022
wines.region: Italie / Northern Italy / Frioul-Vénétie Julienne / Friuli Isonzo
wines.description: It is golden yellow with green reflections. Buttery and vegetables notes, pleasant milk overtones of fresh almonds, mint and sage. It has Soft and enveloping, rich and tasty, gritty and elegant on the palate

wines.name: Pian delle Vigne Brunello di Montalcino 2020
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Toscane / Brunello di Montalcino
wines.description: Marchesi Antinori’s passion for viticulture is expressed through perseverance: their continuous pursuit for quality improvement, even in the smallest details. Research and development is an ongoing process both in the vineyards and in the cellars: selecting new clones of local and international varieties: experimenting with new techniques in the vineyards and vineyard altitudes, new approaches to fermentation and temperature control, experimenting with both traditional and innovative winemaking philosophies, using new types of oak for barrels, barrel size and age, and varying length of aging in the bottle before commercial release.

wines.name: ExcelsuS 2019
wines.description: Deep red wine, definitely fruity with notes of spices, tobacco and coffee. In the mouth you feel the big structure, characterized by important tannins, although they remain gentle on the palate. Enjoyable since now but it also promises a good aging potential.

wines.name: Reserva Especial Ribera del Duero 2020
wines.description: It has high intensity, intense cardinal red with purple hues.The first sensations are fresh and friendly, giving way to the smoothness and fleshiness that characterize the wine. To end with a long aftertaste where we again recall the spicy aromas and caramel.

wines.name: Jumilla Blue Label 2022
wines.description: Purple/black in colour, it proffers a nose of pain grille, graphite, earth notes, spice box, black fruits, and a hint of balsamic. It opens in the glass to reveal density, savory flavors and a lengthy, pure finish.

Intensely smooth with dark forest fruits bursting out. Hints of cocoa (the Barcelona variety, of course) with a subtle underlying minerality. Named after the expression of the plot over the years. This wine is just exceptional.

wines.name: Àn 2019
wines.description: This wine is made from very special and different vineyards. The combination of old Callet vines, that only exist in Mallorca, with a poor and mineral soil (iron ore) under limestone rocks, competing with fruit trees that are planted around the vines, give a unique character to these parcels and to the resulting wines.

wines.name: Corimbo I 2017
wines.description:
Colour:
Cherry red in colour, against a dark background with slight purple edging. Deep, intense colouring..

Nose:
Very intense and voluminous, yet elegant and polished. The fruits of the vineyard and the grape harvest stand out strongly against the hint of ripeness, which is detected at the bottom. Blackberries and damsons are clearly identificable against a background impression of aromatic plants flowering in the pine forest. A deep mineral note rounds off the aromatic profile of this magnificent wine.

Palate:
Voluminous, ample, filling the mouth with black fruits that give way to notes of aromatic plants and earthiness. The wine finishes with a deep freshness, reminiscent of special qualities of the land during an excellent year. The 2010 harvest was magnificent at La Horra, contributing freshness and elegance against a background of impeccable maturity. The fine, fresh tannins add character and class to the Corimbo range, which is a new interpretation of the classic Ribera del Duero.

wines.name: Ribera del Duero Crianza 2023
wines.description: Medium intensity, cherry red with ruby reflections. Rojo cherry with ruby tones trim, upper middle layer. Round and elegant, the palate is velvety, smooth and attractive. These creamy sensations give a great length.

wines.name: Godello Blanco 2023
wines.description: It has discreet, elegant and complex nose with aromas of ripe peach, herbs and citrus.Subtle, balanced, vertical and superb acidity on the palate, moderate affluence, delicate minerality and some salinity in the finish.

wines.name: Numanthia 2019
wines.description: The wine is bright red with intense ruby glints. This intensely aromatic wine displays black fruit, blueberry and blackcurrant, accompanied by notes of fig. Hints of black pepper and clove add spice to the toasted hazelnut aromas. A long and persistent finish of tobacco leaves and balsamic notes highlight the complexity of this wine.

wines.name: Suzzane Rioja 2023
wines.description:
Suzzane is a red wine from the D.O.C La Rioja produced by Oxer Belastegi in Laguardia, Alava.

Oxer Bastegieta is a winemaker who began to produce Chacolí at the family winery in Kortezubi, a small Basque town close to the Urdaibai natural park. He first moved to Rioja to study a masters in oenology and viticulture, where he fell in love with the landscapes of the Rioja Alavesa. He then set up residence in Laguardia in 2009 where he began to inspect the vineyards and began to produce wines from the zone.

Suzzane is another of his wines that comes from 3 small Garnacha vineyards situated in the town of Cárdenas, close to Nájera and home to calcareous-clay soils. The vineyards used are over 105 years old, span across 2.5 hectares and have low yields of around 1000kg per hectare. The vineyards are cultivated and worked organically.

Suzzane ferments in stainless steel tanks using its own yeasts. Following this the wine undergoes malolactic fermentation and is aged in new (500litre) French oak barrels.

wines.name: Suzzane Rioja 2023
wines.description:

wines.name: Reserva Ribera del Duero 2020
wines.description: It has dark red, intense and bright cherry.Elegance and austerity, complex, full of fruit nuances. Aromas of fine wines of the Ribera del Duero. It has an impressive depth with hints of dark fruit, toast and cherry liqueur.Tasty and fresh, smooth, fine and elegant, with a nice balance, achieving a feeling of great wine.

wines.name: Viña Ardanza Reserva 2019
wines.description:
Medium-high cherry red robe, with orange tinted tones on the edge of the glass, clear and brilliant. Intense and complex to the nose. Wild berry aromas predominate, blended with hints of coconut, cinnamon, tobacco and leather. Full-bodied and well structured to the palate, with silky and enveloping tannins.
Long after-taste acquired from its lengthy time in bottle, where its elegant bouquet gains in intensity. This Viña Ardanza continues to evolve without losing its traditional qualities.

wines.name: Beso de Dante 2021
wines.description: Aromas of cassis, with mints notes and smoke. Cascades of red and blackcurrant fruit on the palate. Medium-bodied and classically structured with good density. The Cabernet fruit melds seamlessly with the Malbec,creating a well-structured and balanced blend with moderate tannins and a lengthy finish.

wines.name: Massipa de Scala Dei Garnatxa Blanca - Xenin 2023
wines.description: The nose is very elegant and subtle, with fine aniseed and spice aromas, lightly oaked, with a core of white fruit and balsamic herbs. The palate felt a little austere and tightly coiled, with very good acidity and a sharp finish.

wines.name: Félix Azpilicueta Colección Privada 2020
wines.description: Red cherry color of magnificent intensity. In the mouth, powerful, fresh, spacious, full of Nuances: blueberries, raspberry, blackberry, cocoa, coffee with milk, smoked. Length, softness and elegance leaves in us a pleasant memory

wines.name: Reserva 2021
wines.description: Deep purple. complex nose of fresh fruits, citrus notes, expressive ripe black fruit, spices and herbs with mineral notes with the elegance of hardwood. Boca with lots of volume, balanced with perfectly integrated tannins and great persistence.

wines.name: Vinyes Velles de Samsó 2019
wines.description: Intensely brilliant color with purple highlights.aromas of balsamic pine Presence. Licorice buttons, anise and mineral with notes of fennel and cherry.The palate is seductive, full bodied and well structured.

wines.name: Reserva 2020
wines.description: Particularly subtle nose with ripe fruit aromas harmoniously combined with toasty and spicy notes (vanilla and cinnamon) including roasty nuances and hints of coffee.

wines.name: Clàssic 2017
wines.description: A maroon color, robust, dense and rich flavours , intense aromas.

wines.name: Clos del Portal Tros de Clos 2020
Qué Bonito Cacareaba Blanco 2023
wines.description: The nose is fine and elegant wine. With citrus aromas and notes of aromatic herbs, plus hints of stone fruits (apricot, plum), very mineral. The contribution oak promises a good integration. The palate is fresh, fine and good skeleton.

wines.name: Ribera del Duero Una Cepa I 2019
wines.description: It has plenty of savory red and black fruits.

wines.name: Roda I Reserva Rioja 2019
wines.description: This wine has a deep red background with cherry and red trim. Very intense and fine, with waves of typical freshness of the Atlantic vintages in Rioja Alta. The impact of these waves of flavor sensations of red and black fruit, cherry and plum alternate. Minerals and appear fine and fresh spices.

wines.name: Aalto 2022
wines.description: Deep purple red colour. On the nose we perceive good fruit intensity, a great deal of freshness and hints of well integrated wood. On the palate we find all the elements one can expect from a great vintage: complexity, tannic structure, intensity and elegance. The typical flavours of our grape and our region are evident with liquorice, black berries, coffee, tobacco and spice.

wines.name: LeDomaine Blanco de Guarda 2023
wines.description:
Clean, brilliant, yellow, almost waxy in the glass. On the nose, an intense bouquet of
honey, peaches in syrup, ginger, white flowers and mint fused together with notes of
smoke. Smooth in the mouth, opening up with exotic citrus and white fruit (grapefruit
and apple), merged with a hint of freshly cut hay and aniseed, all blending well with the
wood. Perfectly balanced acidity that brings freshness and a lasting finish without
stepping on its rounded oiliness. A wine for laying down, a wine full of surprises.

wines.name: 200 Monges Rioja Reserva 2014
wines.description: Very intense, deep ruby colour. Hints of ripe red fruit, tobacco, cedar and truffles. Very clean and aromatically intense. Well balanced with noble tannins that are the result of lengthy aging in oak. Flavoursome anf full-bodied with hints of liquorice.

wines.name: Grandes Lindes de Remelluri Jesusa Areta San Vicente de la Sonsierra 2019
Gran Reserva 2015
wines.description: This fine ambassador of Ribera del Duero, is a very delicate blend of jammy berries and old-school oak notes, such as vanilla, tobacco & spices give a surprisingly fresh palate and long finish.

wines.name: Cocó Chardonnay - Albariño 2022
wines.description: It has white fruits such as peaches and pears, syrup and dates notes on a background of honey and vanilla. In the mouth, sweet attack, the fruit is fresh and light displays with lactic hints.

wines.name: T3rno Seleccion de 3 Parcelas Ribera del Duero 2019
wines.description: Deep, bright cherry red, with a purple-black core. Viscous and abundant tears. Aromas of the essence of flowers, fruit, baked fruit, blackberries, blueberries, violet, cocoa, sandalwood and liquorice shine through barrel and bottle aging. The palate is impetuous, robust, meaty. The front is powerful and complex, and leaves us with a long, intense flavor of very ripe grapes, and silky, elegant, round tannins.

wines.name: Ekam Essència 2021
wines.description: Perfectly balanced with the sugar and the citric flavors are focused it lingers in your mouth for a long time it might take some time to better integrate and develop more nuances.

wines.name: Clos Figueres 2021
wines.description: Rich ruby colour with wonderful scents of ripe blackberries and blueberries intermingled with the rich mineral flavours of a great Priorat. On the palate it is approachable with pure intense flavours and a lush smooth texture. Loaded with fresh red and black fruit, intermixed with minerals and spices, the finish is long and smooth.

wines.name: San Vicente Rioja 2021
wines.description: Fresh and lively aromas of sweet dark currants and cherry notes, the palate suggests that this wine will be drinking well in to the next couple of decades. A flurry of juicy black fruits and spicy mocha converse with supple savoury notes aiding in it's complexity and the overall appeal of this defined and well structured wine.

wines.name: Garnacha 2021
wines.description: This wine has a remarkably complex nose, with balsamic aromas, redolent of black fruit, roasted notes and a very good structure in the mouth.

wines.name: Malbec 2021
wines.description:
A richly layered Mendoza Malbec that balances intensity with finesse. Ripe blackberry, dark plum, and morello cherry flow into mocha, graphite, and a touch of licorice, while hints of violet and wild herbs add intrigue and complexity. Full-bodied and velvety, with smooth tannins and lively acidity, it finishes with savory spice and a whisper of toasted oak.

Pair with grilled steak, lamb chops, pork roast, or smoky barbacoa, and enjoy alongside aged Manchego or a rich mushroom stew for a powerful, yet refined dining experience.

wines.name: Cabernet Franc 2021
wines.description: The grapes are sourced from Gualtallary, limestone soils, round rocks and extreme high altitude The gentleness of this wood, brings out the true character of cool climate cabernet franc.

wines.name: Bonarda 2022
wines.description: A deep violet color with bluish reflections. The nose is intense and complex. Intense aromas of ripe black fruit, blackberries, raspberries, black cherries, chocolate and liquor, with some spicy notes of fresh herbs provided by the Cabernet Franc appear. The taste has a sweet impact with silky tannins and aromas of ripe black and red fruits with notes of licorice and vanilla. Its natural acidity is refreshing. By its concentration and complexity the finish is long and persistent.

wines.name: Malleolus 2022
wines.description: Color ripe cherry, background covered with thin layer garnet rim. The nose is a very intense black fruit wine which dominates jam, balsamic and aromatic woods. Equally stand spicy aromas of cloves and coffee, clay minerals touches. The palate is powerful and concentrated great balance. Retronasal appear again spicy, black fruit and aromatic woods. The palate is velvety and excellent integration between fruit and wood.

wines.name: Las Gravas 2021
wines.description: The fermentation is in small underground stone tanks with frequent manual pigegage, under controlled temperatures. Malolactic fermentation takes places entirely in barrel, aging at least 16 months in new French oak barrels; the wines are blended after the oak aging.

wines.name: Mauro 2023
wines.grapes: Shiraz/Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Graciano, Tinto Fino
wines.description: Aromatic profile in the house style with clean, ripe and expressive fruit. Opulence and silkiness go hand in hand in a dense, plush, rounded palate.

wines.name: 1827 Viorica de Purcari 2024
wines.description:
Viorica wine is crafted from carefully selected Viorica grapes and vinified through traditional methods.
Technical characteristics: A dry white wine with a pronounced taste and aromas of lemon, apple, and pear.
Serving mode: Recommended serving temperature: +10…+12 °C.

wines.name: Ca l’Elsa 2019
wines.grapes: Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot

wines.name: Gran Reserva Rioja 2016
wines.description: Deep black cherry hue with violet rims. On the nose there is combination of red berries like wild strawberries and raspberries with undertones of sweet liquorice. The palate is full-bodied and luscious with velvety texture. Great well-balanced acidity together with silky tannins trigger warm velvety mouth feel. Exceptionally elegant wine, full of freshness and great complexity.

wines.name: Crest Petit Rouge 2018
wines.region: France / Languedoc-Roussillon / Côtes du Roussillon / Côtes du Roussillon Villages

wines.name: A Mano Rioja 2019
wines.description: Intese and bright cherry colour, aromas of dark ripe fruit, blackberry, plum, blackcurrant.

wines.name: Le 360 2022
wines.region: France / Vin de Pays / Pays d'Oc / Hérault

wines.name: Santenay Clos Rousseau 1er Cru 2022
wines.region: France / Bourgogne / Côte de Beaune / Santenay / Santenay Premier Cru / Santenay 1er Cru Clos Rousseau

wines.name: Bandol 2021
wines.description: The wine is revealing firmness as well as great elegance. The tannins are distinguished by their velvety texture and finesse. This wine seems to offer juicy fruits from the first sip, it then reveals unexpected depths and lengths with subtle spicy and minty notes.

wines.name: Barre A Mine Blanc Fumé de Pouilly 2023
wines.region: France / La vallée de la Loire / Haute-Loire / Pouilly-Fumé

wines.name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2016
wines.region: France / Bordeaux / Libournais / Saint-Émilion / Saint-Émilion Grand Cru

wines.name: Les Côtes aux Valets Sancerre Blanc 2016
wines.region: France / La vallée de la Loire / Haute-Loire / Sancerre

wines.name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wines.region: France / Bordeaux / Libournais / Saint-Émilion / Saint-Émilion Grand Cru

wines.name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Safres 2023
wines.region: France / Vallée du Rhône / Sud de la vallée du Rhône / Châteauneuf-du-Pape
wines.description:
This wine presents an attractive deep red dress with blood reflections. The nose is on gingerbread aromas, associated with red berries and with licorice. The mouth is fresh, on plum jam/ figs aromas, associated to cherries and raspberries, with spices mark, black pepper
and Indian curry. This wine has a long final.

wines.name: Revirand Saint-Joseph 2022
wines.region: France / Vallée du Rhône / Nord de la vallée du Rhône / Saint-Joseph

wines.name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2018
wines.region: France / Bordeaux / Libournais / Saint-Émilion / Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
